business.headline: Fujiyama Power Systems IPO Day 3: Check latest GMP, subscription status and moreThe IPO, priced between Rs 216 and Rs 228 per share, aims to raise Rs 828 crore. This includes a fresh issue of Rs 600 crore and an offer for sale worth Rs 228 crore by promoters Yogesh Dua and Pawan Kumar Garg.

Capillary Technologies IPO Day 2: Check latest GMP and should you apply?Capillary Technologies' IPO has opened to a cautious start with weak early subscription and a cooling GMP, but long-term brokerage views remain positive, making investors weigh short-term sentiment against long-term potential.

Why buying health insurance should be your first move in personal financeHealth insurance is often treated as an afterthought, yet a single medical emergency can undo years of savings. With rising healthcare costs, early coverage has become the most essential starting point in personal finance.

Sensex, Nifty open in green as earnings optimism lifts sentimentAt around 9:18 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 87.27 points at 84,650.05, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 24.50 points to 25,934.55. Broader market indices were mixed in early trade.

Tenneco Clean Air IPO allotment today: Check status, GMP, and listing detailsInvestors can check their allotment status using either the BSE website or the MUFG Intime India portal. The IPO saw heavy bidding across categories. Overall, it was subscribed 61.79 times.

Trump invests at least $82m in bonds, including sectors boosted by his own policiesDonald Trump purchased over $82 million in corporate and municipal bonds from late August to early October. These investments include sectors benefiting from his administration's policies, raising questions about potential conflicts of interest.

Millennials vs Gen Z: How their crypto portfolios and risk appetites differMillennials and Gen Z are both active in the world of crypto, yet they approach it from very different angles. Their portfolios, strategies and risk appetite reveal how differently each generation views money, technology and long-term investing.

How to execute a will the right way, so your family avoids delays and fightsThe truth is, writing a will is only half the job. The real work begins afterwards. One missing document, one unclear clause or one forgotten instruction is enough to turn a simple inheritance into months of delay and dispute.

Expert explains why your 12% equity returns aren't realMost people believe a 12% equity return is strong growth, but according to an expert, the actual gain after inflation and taxes is much smaller. Here's why your money may not be growing as much as you think.
Fresh ED summons to Anil Ambani in fraud case after he skips second dateIn a continued push to seek clarity in the ongoing investigation, the ED has served another notice to Anil Ambani.
Sensex, Nifty bounce back after volatile day as markets cheer Bihar winThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 84.11 points to close at 84,562.78, while the NSE Nifty50 added 30.90 points to end at 25,910.05.

Why safety worries are growing for India's top executivesThe report shows that 71% of corporate security chiefs in India believe the risk of violence against chief executives has increased in the last two years, marking the highest level recorded globally.

Using BNPL regularly? Your salary may be hiding an invisible debt trapHaving easy access to credit at the tap of your finger via BNPL feels convenient, but could those small pay-later purchases be quietly building into a debt trap that only shows up on payday?

From SSY to FDs: 3 smart investment schemes every parent should knowPlanning for a child's future requires wise financial choices. From government-backed savings to bank deposits, these three investments offer stability and dependable returns for parents.

Verizon to slash 15% of workforce. What's driving the massive cuts?The telecom giant has been under pressure as rivals AT&T and T-Mobile continue to offer cheaper plans and aggressive promotions, especially during the launch of new iPhone models.

Bars, coins or digital: How Indians are buying gold differently after prices crossed Rs 1 lakhFor the first time, gold breached the psychological barrier of Rs 1 lakh, a milestone that once seemed out of reach. Until that point, conversations around gold were filled with speculation: "Will gold really touch one lakh?" But once that threshold was crossed, the sentiment changed entirely.

Gold, silver dip slightly today. Is the recent rally losing steam?At the time of writing, at 12.00 pm, gold on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) was slightly down by 0.30%, trading at Rs 1,26,366 per 10 grams. Silver followed a similar trend, falling 0.69% to Rs 1,61,350 per kg.

Pine Labs shares extend rally after strong IPO debut. Details hereThe stock listed at Rs 242 on the Bombay Stock Exchange, which was a 9.5 percent premium to its issue price. It later surged to Rs 283.70, a gain of 28.5 percent from the issue level. Around 12.33 pm, the shares were trading at Rs 257.35, valuing the company at Rs 29,556.63 crore.

Investor who foresaw 2008 US home crisis closes hedge fund. Here's whyThe investor has spent the past year warning about what he sees as bubbles in the market. He has sharply criticised big technology stocks and the boom in artificial intelligence (AI).

Infosys share buyback record date today: What investors should knowInfosys is conducting the buyback through the tender offer route, where it will purchase shares at Rs 1,800 per share. This is more than 18% above the recent market price of around Rs 1,515.

entertainment.headline: 120 Bahadur becomes the first film to release across India's 800 defence theatres The upcoming war drama '120 Bahadur' will be shown in more than 800 defence cinema halls for soldiers and their families across India starting November 21, marking its nationwide rollout through PictureTime's mobile cinema infrastructure.

Huma Qureshi, rumoured boyfriend hug and kiss at Himesh Reshammiya concert. Watch Actor Huma Qureshi and acting coach Rachit Singh were seen together at an event, drawing attention amid ongoing speculation about their relationship.

Grey's Anatomy actor James Pickens Jr is cancer-free after prostate cancer battle Grey's Anatomy star James Pickens Jr has announced he is cancer-free after battling prostate cancer. He is now using social media platforms to encourage early detection and regular screenings, especially for Black men at higher risk.

Prithviraj breaks silence on Empuraan row, denies using films for political views Actor Prithviraj Sukumaran has publicly responded to the ongoing debate surrounding the film 'Empuraan', emphasising transparency in the filmmaking process.

I loved the film: Scorsese heaps praise on Homebound at New York screening Martin Scorsese has expressed admiration for Neeraj Ghaywan's film 'Homebound', hosting a special screening in New York and praising its portrayal of friendship and systemic realities.

Watch: Akon faces crowd misconduct at Bengaluru show as fans pull his trousers Senegalese-American singer Akon's Bengaluru concert on November 14 has sparked controversy after a viral video from the event showed fans pulling his trousers down during the show.

Shiva vs Om: Classic gangster dramas that redefined the genre in Indian cinema A misconception may have linked them for years, but the legacies of Ram Gopal Varma's 'Shiva' and Upendra's 'Om' stand tall on their own terms.

Euphoria Season 3 wraps filming, photos from wrap party go viral After an extended filming period, 'Euphoria' has finished production on its third season. The new episodes are scheduled to premiere in spring 2026, more than four years after the release of season two.

Kim Kardashian gets emotional about bar exam journey, promises to work harder Beauty mogul Kim Kardashian has shared an emotional account of her experience preparing for and taking the California bar exam, ultimately revealing that she did not pass but remains determined to continue her legal studies.

Dining With The Kapoors: Aadar Jain jokes about Kareena Kapoor's favourite question In the 'Dining With The Kapoors' promo, Aadar Jain revealed cousin Kareena Kapoor Khan's favourite question. 'Dining With The Kapoors' will stream on Netflix from November 21, 2025.

IFFI to felicitate Rajinikanth, Balakrishna for 50 years in cinema: Dr L Murugan Union Minister of State Dr L Murugan announced that legendary actors Rajinikanth and Nandamuri Balakrishna will be felicitated at IFFI, Goa. The honour recognises their iconic body of work and profound influence on Indian film culture over five decades, marking 50 years in cinema.

Rubina-Abhinav win Dhamaal With Pati Patni Aur Panga; crowned Sarvagun Sampann Jodi Rubina Dilaik and Abhinav Shukla were crowned the winners of the 'Sarvagun Sampann jodi,' of the reality show Dhamaal With Pati Patni Aur Panga. Excerpts from an exclusive report by India Today.

Bigg Boss 19: Anuj Sachdeva defends friend Gaurav Khanna against fake allegations Actor Anuj Sachdeva backed his friend, 'Bigg Boss 19' contestant Gaurav Khanna, slamming accusations of him being fake by confirming his genuine nature. Anuj also criticised Amaal Mallik for using abusive language about women and speaking ill of someone's mother, questioning his legacy.

Khatron Ke Khiladi returns with season 15 in 2026: Rohit Shetty on Bigg Boss 19 Director Rohit Shetty confirmed that 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 15' will return next year, making the announcement on the 'Bigg Boss 19' set with Salman Khan. The news assured fans who feared the reality show had been dropped, as Shetty suggested some 'Bigg Boss' contestants could join the next season.

Imran Khan calls comeback a natural progression. Read all about the film here After a decade-long hiatus, actor Imran Khan prepares for his cinematic return with a deeply personal film. His comeback reflects significant life changes and artistic growth, marking a new phase in his career.

Aditi Rao Hydari warns fans against WhatsApp impersonator messaging for photoshoots Aditi Rao Hydari warned fans and photographers about an impersonator using her pictures and name on WhatsApp to message people about photoshoots. She confirmed that she never contacts people for work using a personal number and urged followers to only engage through her official team.

KBC 17: Manoj Bajpayee recreates iconic dialogue from Big B's Deewar in Bhojpuri Manoj Bajpayee, Jaideep Ahlawat, and Sharib Hashmi featured in 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17', where Manoj and Amitabh Bachchan exchanged famous film dialogues in Bhojpuri. The show premieres on Sony Liv and Sony Entertainment Television at 9 pm IST.

Prem Chopra discharged from hospital, family says actor is hale and hearty Veteran actor Prem Chopra has been discharged from Mumbai's Lilavati Hospital following a precautionary stay. His family confirmed that the actor is back home.

Ranveer, Deepika, Aamir enjoy star-studded musical night in Gujarat. See pics Bollywood actors Ranveer Singh, Deepika Padukone and Aamir Khan were seen at a musical event in Gujarat on Saturday. The event featured performances by AR Rahman, Shreya Ghoshal and other renowned singers.

general news.headline: 42 Umrah pilgrims from Telangana killed in Saudi Arabia bus–tanker collisionAt least 42 Indian Umrah pilgrims, many from Hyderabad, were feared dead after their bus collided with a tanker in Saudi Arabia. Telangana officials contacted MEA for details. MP Asaduddin Owaisi sought swift updates and assistance.

I don't care, Allah gave life: Sheikh Hasina defiant ahead of court verdictDeposed Bangladeshi Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina said she did not care what verdict the court will give on the alleged crimes against humanity committed during her regime.

New Bihar government to take oath on Thursday, PM to attend ceremonyThe new Bihar government will take oath at the historic Gandhi Maidan in Patna on November 20, although there's no clarity whether JD(U) chief Nitish Kumar will swear-in as the Chief Minister for a record tenth time.

Jaish-linked terror module planned 'D-6' attack; Umar, Dr Shaheen key plottersAgencies decoded what the group had internally codenamed "Operation D-6" after interrogating terror suspects arrested from Faridabad and Jammu & Kashmir. According to sources, the module had been planning a large-scale suicide strike using a car-borne explosive device, with preparations in motion for weeks.

Why Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj isn't dead, it's just bornPrashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj has drawn a blank in the Bihar Assembly polls, but those writing its political obituary should stop right away. The debutant's 3.4% vote share, which is more than that of the Left parties and the AIMIM combined, is a significant indicator of the traction it has. Though it lost deposits in most seats, it also has third-place finishes in over 54%of the seats contested.

Sanju Samson: Relentless talent wrestling with expectations and the Kambli paradoxSanju Samson's T20I career remains a compelling saga of breathtaking promise and persistent struggle - a journey where repeated opportunities collide with inconsistency and inner battles, shaping what many see as cricket's own Vinod Kambli paradox.

Bangladesh on edge as blasts rock Dhaka ahead of verdict against Sheikh HasinaBangladesh erupted in unrest with explosions, arson, and nationwide protests as authorities braced for the International Crimes Tribunal's verdict on ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, who denounces the trial as illegal.

Parental home stays a daughter's after marriage too: Chirag Paswan on Yadavs' feudChirag Paswan urges the Lalu Prasad Yadav family to resolve their internal disputes swiftly, drawing from his own experience with family crises. The political storm intensifies following Rohini Acharya's public allegations against her family amid RJD's electoral setbacks.

Trolled for height, Bavuma stands tall to rewrite South Africa's Test legacy IND vs SA, 1st Test: Temba Bavuma has often faced trolling for his height, but the South African captain has risen above the odds to win in Kolkata and establish himself as one of his country's most successful Test skippers.

Trump 'okay' with bill sanctioning Russia's trade partners with tariffs up to 500%Donald Trump supports new Senate legislation to impose steep tariffs on countries importing Russian energy. This move aims to pressure major buyers like India and China amid the ongoing Ukraine conflict.

MK Stalin, actors Ajith Kumar, Aravind Swamy and Khushbu get bomb threat emailsPolice received a bomb threat emailed to the DGP office targeting the residences of MK Stalin, Ajith Kumar, Aravind Swamy and Khushbu on Sunday night.

Delhi's air quality remains very poor for 4th straight day despite strong windsDelhi continued to witness 'very poor' air quality levels for a fourth consecutive day despite strong winds blowing across the city on Sunday. The AQI this morning was 359, with Bawana being the worst-affected area with a reading of 427.

Watch: Akon faces crowd misconduct at Bengaluru show as fans pull his trousersSenegalese-American singer Akon's Bengaluru concert on November 14 has sparked controversy after a viral video from the event showed fans pulling his trousers down during the show.

Prithviraj breaks silence on Empuraan row, denies using films for political viewsActor Prithviraj Sukumaran has publicly responded to the ongoing debate surrounding the film 'Empuraan', emphasising transparency in the filmmaking process.

10 bagless days announced for Classes 6–8 in UP government schoolsUttar Pradesh has introduced 10 bagless school days for Classes 6–8, giving students dedicated time for hands-on learning, creative workshops, exposure visits, and interactive group activities. Implemented under SCERT's 'Anandam' (joyful learning) guidelines, the initiative aims to ease academic pressure, reduce rote learning, and create a more engaging, stress-free school experience.

Delhi bomber used social media to push radicalisation, expand Jaish networkInvestigations reveal how Dr Umar Nabi used social media to radicalise educated young people, aiming to build sleeper cells linked to Jaish-e-Mohammed. This new tactic targets unsuspecting professionals, signalling a shift in terror recruitment strategies in India.

Dining With The Kapoors: Aadar Jain jokes about Kareena Kapoor's favourite questionIn the 'Dining With The Kapoors' promo, Aadar Jain revealed cousin Kareena Kapoor Khan's favourite question. 'Dining With The Kapoors' will stream on Netflix from November 21, 2025.

Video: US jewellery shop owner opens fire at robbers after $170,000 heistThe masked robbers who raided a California jewellery store fled in panic after the owner opened fire, though they still escaped with $170,000 worth of jewellery.

After Rohini Acharya, Lalu Yadav's 3 more daughters move out of Patna residenceThe RJD family feud intensifies as three daughters of Lalu Prasad Yadav leave their Patna residence following Rohini Acharya's explosive allegations. This marks a significant deepening of the internal crisis within the party's first family.

Calf injured in J&K during Op Sindoor fitted with artificial 'Krishna limb'Gauri, a calf injured during Pakistan shelling in Operation Sindoor, regained mobility after being fitted with the Krishna Limb by Dr Tapesh Mathur, part of his decade-long work aiding over 500 disabled animals.

Feeling overwhelmed? The 5-5-5 rule pulls you back in secondsOverthinking has almost become second nature to some of us. And when a thought spiral begins, coming out becomes a task. But there is one grounding technique that might just come in handy the next time you go down a rabbit hole.

Dirty kidney, filthy abuses, slipper raised: Rohini Acharya on Yadav family feudRohini Acharya, Lalu Yadav's daughter, quit politics and severed ties with her family, alleging abuse, humiliation, and betrayal by Tejashwi Yadav's aides.

Emotional Rajamouli says he doesn't believe in God at 'Varanasi' event, draws flakAn emotional Rajamouli said he didn't believe in God during the 'Varanasi' launch event. He also said that when his father talked about Lord Hanuman, it angered him. His words have sparked a debate.

Bride-to-be bludgeoned to death by fiance on wedding day after argument over sareeA tragic incident unfolded in Bhavnagar, Gujarat, where a bride was killed by her would-be husband on their wedding day following a dispute over a saree and money. The accused is currently absconding as police intensify their search efforts.

Prabhas's Fauzi to be a two-part epic on forgotten heroes: Hanu RaghavapudiPrabhas steps into the role of a fearless soldier in Hanu Raghavapudi's ambitious two-part film 'Fauzi'. With a striking first poster, the period drama promises a visually grand, emotionally rich tale inspired by forgotten heroes.

120 Bahadur becomes the first film to release across India's 800 defence theatresThe upcoming war drama '120 Bahadur' will be shown in more than 800 defence cinema halls for soldiers and their families across India starting November 21, marking its nationwide rollout through PictureTime's mobile cinema infrastructure.

sports.headline: Jannik Sinner beats Carlos Alcaraz in straight sets to retain ATP Finals title Jannik Sinner successfully defended his ATP Finals title by beating world No.1 Carlos Alcaraz 7-6(4), 7-5 in Turin. Despite Alcaraz taking the No.1 ranking, Sinner capped an exceptional season with another major win on home soil.

Bring back Mohammed Shami: Ganguly tells Gautam Gambhir after Kolkata Test loss Sourav Ganguly has advised Gautam Gambhir to recall Mohammed Shami back into the Test team after the loss to South Africa in Kolkata. Shami last played for India in 2023 during the WTC final.

Cristiano Ronaldo set for record sixth World Cup as Portugal thrash Armenia 9-1 Portugal booked their place at the 2026 FIFA World Cup with a decisive 9-1 victory over Armenia, giving Cristiano Ronaldo the chance to feature in a record sixth World Cup. Hat-tricks from Bruno Fernandes and João Neves headlined the dominant display.

Sanju Samson: Relentless talent wrestling with expectations and the Kambli paradox Sanju Samson's T20I career remains a compelling saga of breathtaking promise and persistent struggle - a journey where repeated opportunities collide with inconsistency and inner battles, shaping what many see as cricket's own Vinod Kambli paradox.

Haaland-inspired Norway thump Italy 4-1 to end 28-year World Cup wait Erling Haaland's two late goals propelled Norway to a 4–1 victory over Italy in Rome, confirming their qualification for the 2026 FIFA World Cup and ending a 28-year absence. Norway finished the group stage with a flawless record, while Italy faces another playoff challenge.

South Africa coach Conrad credits spin revolution for historic Test win in India South Africa coach Shukri Conrad said he was delighted to see his spinners take charge in the first Test against India at the Eden Gardens. Conrad added that the performance showed his side is no longer defined solely as a "fast bowling country" and expressed hope that it will inspire more young slow bowlers back home.

Kris Srikkanth slams Gambhir's Kolkata pitch defence: I would have taken wickets here Former India selector Kris Srikkanth slammed Gautam Gambhir's assessment of the Kolkata pitch after India's loss to South Africa in the first Test in Kolkata. The Eden Gardens track came under the scanner after the match ended in just two and a half days.

Trolled for height, Bavuma stands tall to rewrite South Africa's Test legacy  IND vs SA, 1st Test: Temba Bavuma has often faced trolling for his height, but the South African captain has risen above the odds to win in Kolkata and establish himself as one of his country's most successful Test skippers.

India defeated at their own game in Eden Test loss? South Africa's Temba Bavuma agrees South Africa captain Temba Bavuma's pointed post-match comments added fuel to the Eden Gardens pitch row after India's 30-run loss. He said India lost on the very surface they requested, as his side adapted better to the conditions.

PAK vs SL: Rizwan, Talat guide Pakistan to 6-wicket win, complete 3-0 whitewash Pakistan beat Sri Lanka by 6 wickets in the third ODI to complete a 3-0 whitewash in the series. Mohammad Rizwan and Fakhar Zaman starred with half-centuries while Mohammad Wasim Jr picked up a 3-wicket haul.

India A vs Pakistan A controversy after Naman Dhir catch overruled: What's the rule? The India A vs Pakistan A clash saw fresh controversy after a stunning relay catch involving Nehal Wadhera and Naman Dhir was overruled. The decision followed cricket's updated boundary fielding laws, sparking confusion and strong reactions.

Kris Srikkanth slams Gambhir's Kolkata pitch defence: I would have taken wickets here Former India selector Kris Srikkanth slammed Gautam Gambhir's assessment of the Kolkata pitch after India's loss to South Africa in the first Test in Kolkata. The Eden Gardens track came under the scanner after the match ended in just two and a half days.

India defeated at their own game in Eden Test loss? South Africa's Temba Bavuma agrees South Africa captain Temba Bavuma's pointed post-match comments added fuel to the Eden Gardens pitch row after India's 30-run loss. He said India lost on the very surface they requested, as his side adapted better to the conditions.

PAK vs SL: Rizwan, Talat guide Pakistan to 6-wicket win, complete 3-0 whitewash Pakistan beat Sri Lanka by 6 wickets in the third ODI to complete a 3-0 whitewash in the series. Mohammad Rizwan and Fakhar Zaman starred with half-centuries while Mohammad Wasim Jr picked up a 3-wicket haul.

India A vs Pakistan A controversy after Naman Dhir catch overruled: What's the rule? The India A vs Pakistan A clash saw fresh controversy after a stunning relay catch involving Nehal Wadhera and Naman Dhir was overruled. The decision followed cricket's updated boundary fielding laws, sparking confusion and strong reactions.

Rising Stars Asia Cup: Pakistan hammer India by 8 wickets as no handshake continuesIndia continued their 'no handshake' policy against arch-rivals Pakistan following an 8-wicket defeat in the Rising Stars Asia Cup 2025 in Doha.

India Loses to South Africa; Gambhir Defends Pitch, Ganguly Calls for 'Good Wickets'This special report covers the fallout from India's 30-run Test loss to South Africa at Eden Gardens, featuring an exclusive interview with CAB President Sourav Ganguly and analysis of India Head Coach Gautam Gambhir's press conference. The discussion centres on the controversial pitch, India's batting performance, and team strategy. Following the match, Gautam Gambhir stated, 'this is exactly the pitch we were looking for'.

Shubman Gill discharged from Kolkata hospital, unsure if he will travel to GuwahatiIndia Test captain Shubman Gill has been discharged from hospital and is recovering well after his neck injury at Eden Gardens. India now await clarity on his availability for the second Test after a costly defeat in his absence.

India's skill vs spin gone down: Former stars react after Kolkata Test defeatIndia's Eden Gardens defeat has prompted sharp reactions from former cricketers, who see deeper issues than a single collapse. Many believe the loss reflects declining spin-batting skills and lessons still unlearned since the New Zealand series setback.

IND A vs PAK A Highlights: Pakistan Shaheens beat India A by 8 wicketsIndia A vs Pakistan A, Rising Stars Asia Cup 2025 Highlights: Pakistan Shaheens have clinched a comfortable 8 wickets win against India, having done something their senior team has not been able to do since 2022.

Sai Sudharsan or Devdutt Padikkal? Anil Kumble makes his pick for Guwahati TestIND vs SA, 1st Test: Anil Kumble believes India should turn to Sai Sudharsan if Shubman Gill is unavailable for the Guwahati Test, though adding another left-hander could strengthen Simon Harmer's impact.

Return to Virat Kohli era Indian pitches: Wasim Jaffer after Kolkata Test lossFormer cricketer Wasim Jaffer has called for a return to classic Indian pitches from the Virat Kohli era after India's defeat to South Africa. His comments highlight concerns over current pitch conditions affecting India's home dominance and team performance.

India's Kolkata loss due to modern Test approach, players not to blame: PietersenKevin Pietersen believes India's Kolkata collapse reflects a larger shift in modern Test batting. He says today's techniques prioritise power over patience and argues the players should not be blamed for it.

IND A vs PAK A Highlights: Pakistan Shaheens beat India A by 8 wicketsIndia A vs Pakistan A, Rising Stars Asia Cup 2025 Highlights: Pakistan Shaheens have clinched a comfortable 8 wickets win against India, having done something their senior team has not been able to do since 2022.

Sai Sudharsan or Devdutt Padikkal? Anil Kumble makes his pick for Guwahati TestIND vs SA, 1st Test: Anil Kumble believes India should turn to Sai Sudharsan if Shubman Gill is unavailable for the Guwahati Test, though adding another left-hander could strengthen Simon Harmer's impact.

Return to Virat Kohli era Indian pitches: Wasim Jaffer after Kolkata Test lossFormer cricketer Wasim Jaffer has called for a return to classic Indian pitches from the Virat Kohli era after India's defeat to South Africa. His comments highlight concerns over current pitch conditions affecting India's home dominance and team performance.

India's Kolkata loss due to modern Test approach, players not to blame: PietersenKevin Pietersen believes India's Kolkata collapse reflects a larger shift in modern Test batting. He says today's techniques prioritise power over patience and argues the players should not be blamed for it.

Any Test that finishes in 3 days has demons: Steyn on Gambhir's pitch defenceFormer South Africa fast bowler Dale Steyn countered India coach Gautam Gambhir's defence of the Eden Gardens surface, saying that "any Test that finishes in three days has demons in it, for sure."

Eden Gardens wasn't the best Test wicket: Sourav Ganguly on pitch controversyIND vs SA, 1st Test: CAB president Sourav Ganguly opened up the controversy surrounding the pitch at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata. The opening Test ended in less than three days with South Africa beating India by 30 runs to take a 1-0 lead in the two-match series.

Can't blame batters: Pujara, Chopra disagree with Gambhir's Kolkata pitch remarkIND vs SA, 1st Test: Cheteshwar Pujara and Aakash Chopra strongly disagreed with Gautam Gambhir's remark that the Eden Gardens pitch wasn't difficult for batting and that the batters should have adapted to the conditions.

124 was chasable irrespective of pitch, we should've absorbed pressure: GambhirND vs SA 1st Test: India head coach Gautam Gambhir felt that the target of 124 against South Africa in the first Test was chasable. India lost the series opener by 30 runs after being bundled out for 93 on Day 3 at Eden Gardens, Kolkata.

Sourav Ganguly responds to Kolkata Test pitch row, has a message for Gautam GambhirIndia's Eden Gardens collapse has triggered a fresh debate over the pitch and the team's approach. Sourav Ganguly has now weighed in, offering clarity on the controversy and a pointed message for Gautam Gambhir.

Worst Indian coach: Fans tear into Gambhir after humiliating Kolkata Test lossIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir faces widespread criticism after the team's 30-run defeat to South Africa in the first Test at Eden Gardens. The loss has intensified pressure on Gambhir ahead of the crucial second Test in the series, with India in a danger of losing second Test series at home in as many years.

Anil Kumble 'confused' by Gautam Gambhir's Eden Gardens pitch remarkFormer India captain Anil Kumble admitted he was "confused" after India head coach Gautam Gambhir maintained that the Eden Gardens surface was exactly what the team had asked for ahead of the first Test against South Africa.

Indian batters need to use their feet, be prepared for pitches like Eden: PujaraIND vs SA, 1st Test: India's collapse on a turning Eden pitch has renewed scrutiny of their batting against spin. Cheteshwar Pujara says the team must adapt quickly, using better footwork and scoring options to handle challenging home surfaces.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
